column4: I have a fresh 11.04 install, so when I try to play .mp3 files it seems I don't have the necessary "files" or codecs or whatever so ubuntu prompts me to download them. I start the download but the speed is of the download is in the order of 100 bytes per sec... Is there something wrong here?
Try changing your server.  The default one is usually overrun with other people using so it is slow / possibly very far away from you.
K-Rich:  I would like it not to require a passwd... I've just thought of something though, I'll try it now

I would like this user not to require a password to do 'sudo' stuff because I'll be using it in Filezilla to upload files... Does that mean I have to add it to the 'sudo' group instead? Since  that's the group I can remove password need for, via 'visudo'??
I'm not sure.  I've never done that.  I'm worried that doing so might be a security vulnerability
look harder, unless you manually took it out, it's still in there
log in as a user that can sudo.  Is admin listed in the output of 'groups' ??
I may have manually taken it out.... I was following a website where it was written that to add a user to a group you had to "adduser <groupname> <username>" but it's the other way around
i just did vim /etc/group and there's no admin group there
Is there a reference to the admin group in your /etc/sudoers?
there is, but it's commented out

well at this point you can start adding users to the /etc/sudoers file manually or you can recreate the admin group, fix the sudoers file so it's not commented out, and add the users you want to that group
